page.title: 13School Buildings,Fearn.
page.content: Hill of Fearn Primary School is made up of four classrooms,a general purposes hall and a school kitchen.There are various store cupboards for equipment.Toilets are provided for infants and senior boys and girls.The teachers have a staffroom and a staff toilet.The school buildings are quite old-part is about 100 years old.The canteen, hall and infant room were built in the 1950's.In 1984 a porta-cabin was installed for the senior class.There are 85 pupils and 4 teachers at present.The senior class is taught by the headmaster.Summer of 1985 sees the installation of new windows in the two older classrooms.These will be double glazed.The playground is tarred and is on two levels.The infants have a small paved area to play in.
